result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Dismissed Read In as part of Sentencing Agreement  for 13CF151.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kindle L Mclaughlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls case at 3:00 p.m. Defendant Kindle L McLaughlin in court with attorney Eric P Sheets. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report.
ADA Cousins states joint recommendation:
Count 1 Posses Narcotic Drugs 961.42(3g)(am): W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation:  50 hrs Community Service, Continue with AODA treatment.   Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Only obtain Prescriptions from one pharmacy.  Provide Release of Information to Agent.   Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent. DNA surcharge. $150 + costs.
Count 2  Maintain Drug Trafficking place 961.42(1):  pay costs
14CF95 to be DRI  

BTC:  14CF95 is Dismissed Read In
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$1,000 sig bond:  Comply with all conditions of pending bonds.

Defendant Kindle L Mclaughlin in court with attorney Eric P. Sheets. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC:  $1,000 sig bond:  Comply with all conditions of pending bonds.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kindle L Mclaughlin in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney.  States she has Atty Roeth.
ADA Knaapen states that Atty Roeth doesn't practice around here and suggest Defendant contact Public Defender office today.

Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 

Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls case at  1:16 p.m.
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
14CF95
Court informs of charges and maximum penalties.  
Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Court questions defendant re: counsel.  Defendant did complete PSI
Court Continues initial appearance on 14CF95 so attorney can appear.
3-17-2014 at 1:30 p.m. initial appearance.

Defendant appears from jail by video.
14CF95 and 13CF151
Warrant was issued by Judge Flugaur.  
Court questions defendant re: failure to appear in court yesterday 3-10-2014.  
ADA Cousins makes statement.  
Court calls the defendant's agent, Becky Rausch.  Court questions agent re: completion of PSI.  Agent confirms that the PSI is completed and will send report.
Court reinstates the Bond.
